place.name: BRUMSTEAD
place.gazetteerText: BRUMSTEAD, or Brunstead, a parish in Tunstead district, Norfolk; 1 mile N of Stalham, 3 SW of the coast, 6 SE of North Walsham r. station, and 16 NE of Norwich. Post Town, Stalham, under Norwich. Acres, 789. Real property, £1,400. Pop., 99. Houses, 22. The property is divided among a few. The manor belongs to Cubitt Durrant, Esq. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £170.* Patron, the Earl of Abergavenny. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
